qas.question: Is the Avian flu a risk only to animals?

answers.text: people in contact with live poultry are at the greatest risk of becoming infected with the virus

qas.question: What portion of the world is considered to be most at risk for the rapid spread of the avian flu?

answers.text: areas such as Southeast Asia, where the disease is endemic in the wild bird population and domestic poultry can become infected

qas.question: What is the danger to humans in regards to the spread of avian flu to humans ?

answers.text: The virus possibly could mutate to become highly virulent and infectious in humans and cause an influenza pandemic.

qas.question: Can the avian flu be sread from wild birds to birds kept in husbandry?

answers.text: the disease is endemic in the wild bird population and domestic poultry can become infected.

plausible_answers.text: live poultry are at the greatest risk of becoming infected with the virus

plausible_answers.text: The virus possibly could mutate to become highly virulent and infectious in humans and cause an influenza pandemic

qas.question: Why is the avian influenza considered to be completely safe?
What kind of poultry are immune to avian influenza?
What is most commonly found in people compared to birds?

context: In general, <b8_0>avian influenza<b8_0/> is a disease of birds caused by bird-specific influenza A virus that is not normally transferred to people; however, <a0_0>people in contact with <b4_0>live poultry are at the greatest risk of becoming infected with the virus<b4_0/><a0_0/> and this is of particular concern in <a1_0><b5_0>areas such as Southeast Asia<b5_0/>, where <a3_0>the disease is endemic in the wild bird population and <b7_0>domestic poultry<b7_0/> can become infected<a1_0/>.<a3_0/> <a2_0><b6_0>The virus possibly could mutate to become highly virulent and infectious in humans and cause an influenza pandemic<b6_0/>.
